I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
pl_path_incl_length_def pl_path_nil prec_empty

Premises:
pl_path_incl_length_def = fun (plp : pl_path) (pl : prec_list) => forall n : nat, pl_path_incl plp pl -> pl_tl_length pl n -> pl_path_length plp = n : pl_path -> prec_list -> Prop
Inductive pl_path : Set := pl_path_nil : pl_path | pl_path_cons : ad -> pl_path -> pl_path
pl_path_rec_equiv_1_0 = fun (_ : pl_path_incl pl_path_nil prec_empty) (d : preDTA) (tl : term_list) (n : nat) (H0 : pl_path_recon d tl pl_path_nil) (_ : pl_tl_length prec_empty n) => let H2 : d = d -> tl = tl -> pl_path_nil = pl_path_nil -> liste_reconnait d prec_empty tl := match H0 in (pl_path_recon p t p0) return (p = d -> t = tl -> p0 = pl_path_nil -> liste_reconnait d prec_empty tl) with | pl_path_rec_nil d0 => fun (H2 : d0 = d) (H3 : tnil = tl) (H4 : pl_path_nil = pl_path_nil) => (fun H5 : d0 = d => let H6 : d0 = d := H5 in eq_ind_r (fun _ : preDTA => tnil = tl -> pl_path_nil = pl_path_nil -> liste_reconnait d prec_empty tl...
Inductive pl_path_incl : pl_path -> prec_list -> Prop := pl_path_incl_nil : pl_path_incl pl_path_nil prec_empty | pl_path_incl_cons : forall (plp : pl_path) (a : ad) (la ls : prec_list), pl_path_incl plp la -> pl_path_incl (pl_path_cons a plp) (prec_cons a la ls) | pl_path_incl_next : forall (plp : pl_path) (a : ad) (la ls : prec_list), pl_path_incl plp ls -> plp <> pl_path_nil -> pl_path_incl plp (prec_cons a la ls)
pl_path_rec_nil : forall d : preDTA, pl_path_recon d tnil pl_path_nil
pl_path_incl_ind : forall P : pl_path -> prec_list -> Prop, P pl_path_nil prec_empty -> (forall (plp : pl_path) (a : ad) (la ls : prec_list), pl_path_incl plp la -> P plp la -> P (pl_path_cons a plp) (prec_cons a la ls)) -> (forall (plp : pl_path) (a : ad) (la ls : prec_list), pl_path_incl plp ls -> P plp ls -> plp <> pl_path_nil -> P plp (prec_cons a la ls)) -> forall (p : pl_path) (p0 : prec_list), pl_path_incl p p0 -> P p p0
Inductive pl_path : Set := pl_path_nil : pl_path | pl_path_cons : ad -> pl_path -> pl_path
pl_compat = fun pl0 pl1 : prec_list => pl0 = prec_empty /\ pl1 = prec_empty \/ pl0 <> prec_empty /\ pl1 <> prec_empty : prec_list -> prec_list -> Prop
pl_path_incl_next : forall (plp : pl_path) (a : ad) (la ls : prec_list), pl_path_incl plp ls -> plp <> pl_path_nil -> pl_path_incl plp (prec_cons a la ls)
pl_path_length = fix pl_path_length (plp : pl_path) : nat := match plp with | pl_path_nil => 0 | pl_path_cons _ p => S (pl_path_length p) end : pl_path -> nat
pl_compatible_empt_l : forall p : prec_list, pl_compatible prec_empty p -> p = prec_empty
pl_compatible_empt_r : forall p : prec_list, pl_compatible p prec_empty -> p = prec_empty
pl_path_rec_equiv_1_2 : forall (plp : pl_path) (a : ad) (la ls : prec_list), pl_path_incl plp ls -> pl_path_rec_equiv_1_def plp ls -> plp <> pl_path_nil -> pl_path_rec_equiv_1_def plp (prec_cons a la ls)
pl_path_ind : forall P : pl_path -> Prop, P pl_path_nil -> (forall (a : ad) (p : pl_path), P p -> P (pl_path_cons a p)) -> forall p : pl_path, P p
pl_path_rect : forall P : pl_path -> Type, P pl_path_nil -> (forall (a : ad) (p : pl_path), P p -> P (pl_path_cons a p)) -> forall p : pl_path, P p
pl_path_rec : forall P : pl_path -> Set, P pl_path_nil -> (forall (a : ad) (p : pl_path), P p -> P (pl_path_cons a p)) -> forall p : pl_path, P p
pl_tl_length_rec_1 : forall d : preDTA, pl_tl_length_rec_def_1 d prec_empty tnil
rec_empty : forall d : preDTA, liste_reconnait d prec_empty tnil
pl_path_rec_equiv_0_0 : forall d : preDTA, pl_path_rec_equiv_0_def d prec_empty tnil
liste_rec_length_0 : forall d : preDTA, liste_rec_length_def d prec_empty tnil
semantic_equiv_1_2 : forall d : preDTA, pre_reconnait d prec_empty tnil (rec_empty d)
conservation_1 : forall (d : preDTA) (l : term_list), 1 <= essence_list l d prec_empty
Inductive pl_path_recon : preDTA -> term_list -> pl_path -> Prop := pl_path_rec_nil : forall d : preDTA, pl_path_recon d tnil pl_path_nil | pl_path_rec_cons : forall (d : preDTA) (a : ad) (t : term) (plp : pl_path) (tl : term_list), reconnaissance d a t -> pl_path_recon d tl plp -> pl_path_recon d (tcons t tl) (pl_path_cons a plp)
sem_listes_2 : forall (d : preDTA) (pl : prec_list), liste_reconnait d pl tnil -> pl = prec_empty
Inductive prec_list : Set := prec_cons : ad -> prec_list -> prec_list -> prec_list | prec_empty : prec_list
sem_listes_1 : forall (d : preDTA) (hd : term) (tl : term_list), ~ liste_reconnait d prec_empty (tcons hd tl)
non_empty_pl_path_exists : forall pl : prec_list, pl <> prec_empty -> exists p : pl_path, pl_path_incl p pl /\ 1 <= pl_path_length p

apply pl_path_incl_ind.
- intros. apply pl_path_incl_nil.
- intros. apply pl_path_incl_cons.
